thread.title: Canadiens' Zack Kassian injured in car crash
thread.title_full: Canadiens' Zack Kassian injured in car crash

title: Canadiens' Zack Kassian injured in car crash
text:
Canadiens' Zack Kassian injured in car crash 
THE CANADIAN PRESS Sunday, October 04, 2015 05:51 PM EDT | Updated: Sunday, October 04, 2015 06:02 PM EDT Mark Fraser of the Toronto Maple Leafs fights with Zack Kassian of the Montreal Canadiens during preseason NHL action at the Air Canada Centre in Toronto on Saturday September 26, 2015. Dave Abel/Toronto Sun Report an error 
Montreal Canadiens forward Zack Kassian was treated for minor injuries in hospital Sunday morning after being involved in a traffic accident, a team spokesman said. 
Reports said Kassian was not driving the vehicle, which crashed into a tree Sunday morning at about 6 a.m. 
There were two women, one of them the driver, in the vehicle at the time. 
The Canadiens, who played a pre-season game in Ottawa on Saturday night, were given Sunday off and resume practice on Monday. 
Kassian, 24, was acquired in a trade with the Vancouver Canucks in the off-season. Zack Kassian of Montreal Canadiens injured in truck crash http://t.co/Fe1gs3ETOJ pic.twitter.com/QJMYIHOFic â€” Douglas Gelevan (@DGelevan) October 4, 2015 Sponsored Links
